author: bridge-bot
content:
<chfast> Have we considered bumping all gas costs 10x up front to have more leg room for adjusting costs for the cheapest instructions. It worries me that we will completely disable strength reduction incentives for compilers if every instruction cost 1. It may have negative impact of the actual throughput of the network.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Strength_reduction

I think that was mentioned initially, but the only point would be if the variance between the opcodes rounded to 1 was high enough to justify it. Is strength reduction really possible with the compute opcodes priced correctly?

author: bridge-bot
content:
<chfast> re: **@sophiagold0**
> I think that was mentioned initially, but the only point would be if the variance between the opcodes rounded to 1 was high enough to justify it. Is strength reduction really possible with the compute opcodes priced correctly?
It is done already following the current gas costs, e.g. `div(x, 2)` is replaced with `shr(1, x)` by solidity.
